feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 10:30AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues due to warmer temperatures. * WHERE...The northern Copper River Basin along the Gulkana River and along Lake Louise Road.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 6:25PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Houston and southwestern Early Counties through 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 9:42AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heating Up This Week, Then a Breezy Weekend... * Summer`s first multi-day period of heat is projected Thursday through Saturday. Highs well into the 90s in Western Nevada and into the 80s for Sierra communities are expected, with potential for some records on Friday. There is a 20-25% chance of cities such as Reno and Fallon hitting 100 degrees on Friday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 9:42AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heating Up This Week, Then a Breezy Weekend... * Summer`s first multi-day period of heat is projected Thursday through Saturday. Highs well into the 90s in Western Nevada and into the 80s for Sierra communities are expected, with potential for some records on Friday. There is a 20-25% chance of cities such as Reno and Fallon hitting 100 degrees on Friday.

James River at Columbia affecting Brown County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE...

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 8:56AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...GUSTY SOUTH-SOUTHEAST WINDS THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE COASTAL COUNTIES, ALONG WITH SOUTHERN HIDALGO COUNTY... Observations indicate strong south-southeasterly winds across Kenedy, Willacy, Cameron, and Southern Hidalgo counties. Locations in these counties can expect sustained wind speeds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts between 35 and 40 mph this afternoon through
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cameron Island; Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Kenedy Island; Southern Hidalgo; Willacy Island

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 7:22AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees this afternoon over the Victoria Crossroads and portions of the Coastal Bend. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 06 at 11:13AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RAIN AND SNOW MELT WILL RESULT IN RISES ON RIVERS AND SMALL STREAMS IN THE CASCADES LATE THIS WEEK INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... An atmospheric river arrives on Thursday into the weekend bringing periods of moderate rainfall and warm, windy conditions. Rain amount of 1 to 3 inches is possible along the Cascade crest. In addition melting of mid and high elevation snow will add to runoff
